273: Cash Management Specialist OnsiteLocation: Newport Beach 92660Duration: 6+ monthsCompensation: $21-$23/hr. W2Work Requirements: US Citizen, GC Holders or Authorized to Work in the USJob Description:The Cash Management Specialist is responsible for reviewing, analyzing, reconciling, and researching activities related to all corporate bank accounts. This position will serve as a liaison between the Treasury Department and financial institutions for questions regarding debits, credits, and charges to corporate accounts. The Main responsibilities are daily and monthly cash reconciliations for all corporate accounts, resolving cash issues in a timely manner by recording and following up on reconciling items, functioning as a point of contact for banking activities with the ability to research and resolve moderately complex questions and issues.Key ResponsibilitiesThe Cash Management Specialist will be responsible for the following: Track all cash receipts and disbursements daily.Prepare and record journal entries.Maintain account reconciliation spreadsheets.Record payments in the A/P sub-ledgerReconciliation of bank accounts monthlyAudit team members' journal entriesAudit and/or clear manual wire paymentsReconciliation of PNC A/P credit cards and corporate cardsInteract with various bank institutions to research and resolve questions and issuesPosition Requirements Minimum of a bachelor's degree in finance, Accounting, or a related fieldOne - two years of prior Cash Management experience preferred.Strong accounting fundamentalsIntermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel and OutlookFamiliar with SAP or other large ERP systemsStrong sense of urgency and ability to organize and prioritize; including handling multiple tasks with strict deadlinesEffective written and verbal communication skills with the ability to engage professionally and succinctly with all levels across the firm.Ability to work with a strong sense of accountability, integrity, and ownershipAbility to collaborate and contribute to a team environment as well as independently.Committed to PIMCO's values: Collaboration, Openness, Responsibility, and Excellence that allow us to bring the best to our clients and each other.Professional Skills Requirements Exceptional organizational skills, including the ability to multi-task and manage competing priorities.Ability to deliver on assigned responsibilities with attention to detail, and use of effective interpersonal and communication skills.Flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities, manage deadlines, and support initiatives in a fast-paced environment.Adaptable to learning new processes, concepts, and skills.Our benefits package includes:Comprehensive medical benefitsCompetitive pay, 401(k)Retirement planAbout INSPYR Solutions:TekPartners and Genuent are becoming INSPYR Solutions.
